subject: tests: Organize the test code to make it modular
commitMessage:
tests: Organize the test code to make it modular

The unit test code for libpldmresponder, host-bmc and common is
in a shared test directory. This patch separates the test code
to the respective directory.

Tested: Ran the unit test and tests passed.

Signed-off-by: Tom Joseph <rushtotom@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I31d53681fa6c0d8bc6eb7c4e3341aaff4bc341ee

typo, libpldmresponder
Done

we seemed to repeat this is every meson test file, can't we just declare this in the meson file at the root level, and then reuse the objects in the subsequent subdirs ? as the variables from root can be used in subdirs().
Ack, will do that
here as well.
Ack will do that.
can we drop this ? as build via x86 sdk is obsolete now ? if answer is "no",IMO then we should also define it once, and reuse it ..otherwise ..this looks like a clutter in every meson test file.

> can we drop this ? as build via x86 sdk is obsolete now ?
Is there a formal decision by the community? .I am aware that the community is not excited to support x86SDK and rather prefer run the local CI. I still use an x86SDK while developing unit tests. If it comes to a situation where every OpenBMC repo removes support for x86SDK, pldm can also do it.

It is a good suggestion to move it to the base meson.build to avoid the clutter.

No, there is no formal decision as such. But most of the repo's already dropped it.

And why are we needing this piece in the first place ? is it because we are not getting something from the x86sdk ? IMO we should not be carry forwarding these sdk related workarounds in the individual repos. But i would leave it to the maintainers to decide.
